abstract: Microsoft said it would buy back $40 billion of its shares, H.P. would repurchase $8 billion in shares and Nike said it would take on $5 billion.
snippet: Microsoft said it would buy back $40 billion of its shares, H.P. would repurchase $8 billion in shares and Nike said it would take on $5 billion.
lead_paragraph: Eager to project confidence in turbulent markets, Microsoft, Hewlett-Packard and Nike announced plans separately on Monday to buy back a combined $53 billion of their companies’ stock, a move that could benefit shareholders and attract new investors.

headline.main: Microsoft, Hewlett-Packard and Nike Announce Buyback Plans for Shares
headline.print_headline: Microsoft, Hewlett-Packard and Nike Announce Buyback Plans for Shares

abstract: Eager to project confidence in turbulent markets, Microsoft, Hewlett-Packard and Nike announced plans separately on Monday to buy back a combined $53 billion of their companies’ stock — a move, The New York Times’s Michael M. Grynbaum noted, that could benefit shareholders and attract new investors.
lead_paragraph: Eager to project confidence in turbulent markets, Microsoft, Hewlett-Packard and Nike announced plans separately on Monday to buy back a combined $53 billion of their companies’ stock — a move, The New York Times’s Michael M. Grynbaum noted, that could benefit shareholders and attract new investors.

headline.main: Microsoft, H.P. and Nike Announce Buyback Plans for Shares

abstract: Oracle makes its third attempt to go after Microsoft’s collaboration software with a new suite called Beehive.
snippet: Oracle makes its third attempt to go after Microsoft’s collaboration software with a new suite called Beehive.
lead_paragraph: Spend $34 billion acquiring 50 companies in five years, and, well, people might start to forget that you can make your own software at home.

headline.main: Oracle’s Homegrown Push to Out-Collaborate Microsoft
